news.title: Met Éireann confirms ‘prolonged spell of very warm weather’ this week with Oasis fans set for a scorcher
news.summary: Suncream and bucket hats at the ready!

news.title: ‘What we went through was horrific’ – families angry after Swiss clinic helped Irish woman to die in secret despite its promises
news.summary: Two families whose loved ones ended their lives at a Swiss clinic in secret have said they are heartbroken that another family has been put through a similar ordeal.

news.title: Trump says he’s deploying National Guard in Washington DC to tackle crime and homelessness
news.summary: US President Donald Trump said Monday he’s placing the Washington, D.C., police department under federal control and deploying the National Guard to make the nation’s capital safer.

news.title: Two gardaí in the midlands to stand trial in circuit criminal court
news.summary: Two gardaí are to stand trial in the circuit criminal court accused of a number charges in the midlands.

news.title: Pat Spillane: My bugbears and random thoughts post-Championship 2025 – and why the GAA could do a lot better
news.summary: The week after an All-Ireland final win is always very special in Kerry. And while it may have been the 39th title, believe me, they celebrated the latest All-Ireland success with the same enthusiasm, the same atmosphere and the same feel-good factor as always.

news.title: ‘We never stopped hoping and praying’ – Cork woman dies after 17 years with locked-in syndrome
news.summary: A woman who was effectively a prisoner in her own body for 17 years has died.

news.title: Pharma tycoon Gareth Sheridan (35) says he'll fund his Áras campaign from his personal savings
news.summary: A wealthy businessman who has announced a run for the presidency says he will be funding the campaign from his savings.

news.title: Dear Vicki: ‘The company I worked for has stiffed me over a €500 voucher it promised. How far should I push it?’
news.summary: Three months ago I help to train new staff in the company where I was working. In the previous two years I had been refused a salary increase. After I helped with the training, my manager promised the company would give me a €500 voucher as a ‘thank you’ for all the support I had provided.

news.title: Marcus O’Laoire: ‘Rachael and I met, swiped right, at the start of lockdown. Now we’ve a baby on the way. Best thing we’ve ever cooked together’
news.summary: Marcus O’Laoire (36) is a chef, DJ and comedian who lives in Dublin with his partner Rachael.

news.title: Man killed in Downpatrick named and priest remains in hospital after ‘brutal attack’ that police believe may be linked
news.summary: A man in his 50s killed in Downpatrick over the weekend has been named locally as Stephen Brannigan.
